name: Voting results from four polling stations
instruction:
There are four polling stations and five candidates.

The function `getVotingResults` needs to be written.

The function takes four objects as input.

Each object contains information about the votes for each candidate from one polling station.

Each object has the following structure:
* `candidate1` - number of votes for the first candidate, number
* `candidate2` - number of votes for the second candidate, number
* `candidate3` - number of votes for the third candidate, a number
* `candidate4` - number of votes for the fourth candidate, number
* `candidate5` - number of votes for the fifth candidate, number

The function should return a string of the form: `candidate3 Wins! 150 votes`.

An example of running the function:
```javascript
const votingResults1 = { candidate1: 10, candidate2: 20, candidate3: 30, candidate4: 40, candidate5: 50 };
const votingResults2 = { candidate1: 10, candidate2: 20, candidate3: 30, candidate4: 40, candidate5: 50 };
const votingResults3 = { candidate1: 10, candidate2: 20, candidate3: 30, candidate4: 40, candidate5: 50 };
const votingResults4 = { candidate1: 10, candidate2: 20, candidate3: 30, candidate4: 40, candidate5: 50 };
getVotingResults(votingResults1, votingResults2, votingResults3, votingResults4);
// candidate5 Wins! 200 votes
```

The function will always pass data where only one candidate has the most votes.

There will be no situation where two or more candidates have the same number of votes.
